summary: This is a superseding indictment filed in the Southern District of New York against Ghislaine Maxwell. It charges her with six counts related to the sexual exploitation of minors, including conspiracy to entice minors to travel for illegal sex acts, enticement, transportation of a minor, and perjury. The document details her role in recruiting, grooming, and facilitating the abuse of multiple minor victims by Jeffrey Epstein between approximately 1994 and 1997, and alleges she lied under oath in 2016 to conceal her conduct.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Charged with conspiracy, enticement, transportation of minors, and perjury for her role in facilitating Jeffrey Epstein's sexual abuse of minor girls.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The primary perpetrator of the sexual abuse of minors; Maxwell is alleged to have assisted, facilitated, and contributed to his abuse.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: Signed the superseding indictment as the Acting U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York.

connections.description: Maxwell and Epstein conspired to entice and transport minor girls across state and international lines to engage in illegal sex acts.
Had an intimate relationship; Maxwell was paid by Epstein to manage his properties and was among his closest associates.
Maxwell facilitated Epstein's access to minor victims, groomed them, and was present for and participated in sexual abuse.

events.title: Conspiracy and Abuse Period
events.description: Maxwell and Epstein conspired to recruit, groom, and sexually abuse multiple minor victims at various residences.

events.title: Minor Victim-1 Travel from Florida to New York
events.description: Minor Victim-1 was enticed to travel from Florida to New York for the purpose of being sexually abused by Epstein at his New York residence.

events.title: Massage of Minor Victim-2 in New Mexico
events.description: Maxwell provided an unsolicited, topless massage to Minor Victim-2 at Epstein's New Mexico residence as part of grooming.

events.title: Grooming of Minor Victim-3 in London
events.description: Maxwell groomed Minor Victim-3 in London, introduced her to Epstein, and encouraged massages knowing they would lead to sexual abuse.

events.title: False Deposition Testimony (First)
events.description: During a civil deposition, Maxwell falsely testified she was unaware of any scheme by Epstein to recruit underage girls for sexual massages and denied interacting with minors other than the plaintiff.

events.title: False Deposition Testimony (Second)
events.description: During a civil deposition, Maxwell falsely denied awareness of sex toys at Epstein's Palm Beach house, knowledge of Epstein's other sexual partners, and ever giving anyone a massage.

locations: Upper East Side, Manhattan, New York (Epstein's New York Residence)
Palm Beach, Florida (Epstein's Palm Beach Residence)
Santa Fe, New Mexico (Epstein's New Mexico Ranch)
Southern District of New York (jurisdiction for the indictment)
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell is charged with conspiring with Jeffrey Epstein to entice and transport minor girls across state and international lines for illegal sexual activity from at least 1994 to 1997.
The indictment details a grooming process where Maxwell befriended victims as young as 14, normalized sexual topics and nudity, and encouraged sexualized massages that led to abuse.
Specific victims are identified as Minor Victim-1 (abused in New York and Florida), Minor Victim-2 (groomed in New Mexico), and Minor Victim-3 (groomed and abused in London).
Maxwell is charged with two counts of perjury for providing false testimony under oath in 2016 depositions, denying knowledge of Epstein's scheme and her own involvement.
The document alleges Maxwell played a central role in facilitating Epstein's abuse by managing access to victims and participating in some sexual encounters.
